snippet: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei dismissed the idea of bilateral talks with the United States on Thursday, while scoffing at Iranian officials who might consider such negotiations.
abstract: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran's supreme leader, rejects any idea of bilateral talks with United States in speech in which he seems to dismiss views of Iranian officials who had advocated for such negotiations.

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei dismissed the idea of bilateral talks with the United States on Thursday, while scoffing at Iranian officials who might consider such negotiations.

headline.seo: Iran’s Leader Rejects Direct Talks With U.S.
headline.main: Supreme Leader of Iran Rejects Direct Talks With U.S.
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Leader Rejects Direct Talks With U.S.
